title: How Pleasant Is The Sound Of Praise!
author: Thomas Kelly (1769-1855)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

v1: How pleasant is the sound of praise!
It well becomes the saints of God;
Should we refuse our songs to raise,
The stones might tell our shame abroad.
v2: For Him Who washed us in His blood,
Let us our sweetest songs prepare;
He sought us wand'ring far from God,
And now preserves us by His care.
v3: One string there is of sweetest tone,
Reserved for sinners saved by grace;
And touched by one peculiar race.
v4: Though angels may with rapture see
How mercy flows in Jesus' blood,
It is not theirs to prove, as we,
The cleansing virtue of this flood.
v5: Though angels praise the heavenly King,
And worship Him as God alone,
"He wears our nature on the throne."
v6: Sweet truth! It yields unceasing cause
Of wonder and of praise above;
That man, who late accurséd was,
Should be the object of such love.
